publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2512 Rosie Kane: Removal of Coca-Cola from the Scottish Parliament Estate—That the Parliament respects the human rights of people throughout the world; despises the activities of multinationals which erode those rights; is determined to ensure the rights of workers to organise; condemns the killing of eight trade unionists working at the Coca-Cola bottling plant in Colombia; is concerned for communities in India who have lost their water supply due to Coca-Cola’s activities there, and resolves to defend those workers and communities by taking a principled stance and removing all Coca-Cola products from the Parliament estate immediately. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*, Carolyn Leckie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Frances Curran*
